Description: Figure of standing nude male flute-player in glazed composition; back pillar perforated for suspension; very pale blue glaze with added brown glaze; much worn glaze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by The Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
elongated version of Petrie 1886, Pl. II, 7.
Bibliographic references: Webb 1978 / Archaic Greek Faience, Miniature scent bottles and related objects from East Greece, 650-500BC (no. 291)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OM.07)
